4) The Five-Year Accident History:

There have been no reportable accidents at Wiley Companies in the last 5 years.

5) The Emergency Response Program:

In the event of an emergency, Wiley Companies has an emergency action plan in place, which contains procedures for employees to follow, including notification of local response agencies.  Wiley Companies also keeps an Integrated Contingency Plan that is sent to local emergency responders. All facility employees are trained in their role in the emergency action plan, and Wiley Companies policy requires that emergency drills be conducted at least annually. Wiley Companies employees will not respond to an emergency as the organization does not have trained first responders. In the event of an emergency release from the Acetaldehyde System with a possible offsite consequence, the city of Coshocton Fire Department will be notified by calling 911. The Coshocton Fire Department has been informed of the storage of Acetaldehyde and location of Acetaldehyde system. The Coshocton Fire Department conducts an annual site walkthrough. The Acetaldehyde system has its own emergency shutdown devices. Part of the shutdown procedure involves disconnecting the electrical supply to the facility, shutting the facility natural gas supply and performing the emergency shutdown.

Wiley Companies RMP Executive Summary:
 
1) Your Facility and the Regulated Substances Handled

Wiley Companies is a producer of Dietary Supplement Ingredients, Food Ingredients, Pharmaceutical Intermediates, Flavors, Food Additives, Specialty Gases and Fine Chemicals. We are committed to being the best performing Batch/Toll Manufacturer in all aspects of our business, including safety, health and environmental affairs. As a dynamic, fully capable custom processor, we apply our expertise in taking products from the research stage through process design and plant construction to finished goods.  Internally Wiley Companies uses a combination of extensive engineering standards, design, safety work processes, coupled with operational and personnel safety programs to ensure the safe operation of all of our facilities. 

The following chemical that will be used here at Wiley Companies is regulated by the EPA's Risk Management Program rule, in excess of their threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds:

 Acetalydehyde System 
     1. Acetaldehyde

Multiple worst-case and alternative worst-case scenarios were developed for the Acetaldehyde system. 

Acetaldehyde is listed as a regulated flammable substance in EPA's Risk Management Program rule, with a threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds. The Acetaldehyde system storage, distillation and transfer process at Wiley Companies contains up to 20,000 pounds of chemical and materials.
